channel.title: Alternate MineCraft Server
channel.description:
Working on an alternative MineCraft Server(due to the fact that it was horribly programmed -.-) Just showing the disconnect packet. I'm working on the world generation right now. Only thing I'm having trouble is random noise/world generation.
Will be using NIO, and MySQL(for better chunk loading/saving). Backing up will be daily, and instead of saving the whole contents of each chunk each time, just saving the changes(will also make logging much easier).
[IMG]http://i44.photobucket.com/albums/f8/zyle269952/Minecraft.png[/img]
Will be keeping up with progress regularly.

item.title: Alternate MineCraft Server
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“vortex, post:16, topic:388643”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=484463.msg3550465#msg3550465 date=1301466611]

[quote author=Newty link=topic=484463.msg3550462#msg3550462 date=1301465546]
What all have you done so far? How well documented is the client?
[/quote]Considering it’s obfuscated and no one else has really done anything with it, I doubt it’s documented
[/quote]http://mcp.ocean-labs.de/[/quote]

And some people have documented the protocol here: http://wiki.vg/Protocol.

I’m also working on an open-source MC server here: https://github.com/grahamedgecombe/lightstone if you want to use any of it for reference.

Read full topic

item.title: Alternate MineCraft Server
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:12, topic:388643”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=484463.msg3550662#msg3550662 date=1301498533]
The problem isn’t just the server, it is that the way the program is written the client is implicitly trusted, which is always a horrible thing to do in a client-server program. To make it better, you need to write a new client and server, without keeping the protocol the same.
[/quote]

That’s what I plan to do. Kind of like how I have my RS server set up. You can tell it to either use the Jagex protocol, or you can tell it to use my altered protocol(which i find to be better, but then again I’m a bit biased ^_^)[/quote]

Well either way, good luck mate.

Read full topic

item.title: Alternate MineCraft Server
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

The problem isn’t just the server, it is that the way the program is written the client is implicitly trusted, which is always a horrible thing to do in a client-server program. To make it better, you need to write a new client and server, without keeping the protocol the same.

That’s what I plan to do. Kind of like how I have my RS server set up. You can tell it to either use the Jagex protocol, or you can tell it to use my altered protocol(which i find to be better, but then again I’m a bit biased ^_^)

Read full topic

item.title: Alternate MineCraft Server
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

The problem isn’t just the server, it is that the way the program is written the client is implicitly trusted, which is always a horrible thing to do in a client-server program. To make it better, you need to write a new client and server, without keeping the protocol the same.

Thats rewriting the entire game, which would be nice, but just implementing a server a lot less work and millions of people have already purchased the client.

But I agree that during my experiences while writing my server, the way the server, client, and protocol are designed is absolutely horrible.

Read full topic

item.title: Alternate MineCraft Server
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:5, topic:388643”][quote author=Newty link=topic=484463.msg3550462#msg3550462 date=1301465546]
What all have you done so far? How well documented is the client?
[/quote]Considering it’s obfuscated and no one else has really done anything with it, I doubt it’s documented ;P[/quote]

What I should have said is “How far along are you in renaming the client and documenting it yourself?”

Read full topic

item.title: Alternate MineCraft Server
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Newty:

What all have you done so far? How well documented is the client?

So far I have logging in, server password protection, and user registration(just simple database stuff).

The client is obfuscated, but I have most of the packets documented. Some fields I’m still iffy about(doesn’t seem like their used anywhere >.>) but other than that, world generation is unknown, and how the client renders the game world is unknown as well(Well, aside from the calls to the lwjgl library).

Read full topic
